segment.source: The Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) Client enables administrators to enforce and monitor BitLocker drive encryption on computers in the enterprise.
segment.target: The Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) Client enables administrators to enforce and monitor BitLocker drive encryption on computers in the enterprise.

segment.source: If computers that have a Trusted Platform Module (TPM) chip, the BitLocker client can be integrated into an organization by enabling BitLocker management and encryption on client computers as part of the imaging and Windows deployment process.
segment.target: If computers that have a Trusted Platform Module (TPM) chip, the BitLocker client can be integrated into an organization by enabling BitLocker management and encryption on client computers as part of the imaging and Windows deployment process.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To review the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring Client system requirements, see MBAM 2.0 Supported Configurations.
segment.target: To review the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring Client system requirements, see MBAM 2.0 Supported Configurations.

segment.source: Encrypting client computers with BitLocker during the initial imaging stage of a Windows deployment can lower the administrative overhead necessary for implementing MBAM in an organization.
segment.target: Encrypting client computers with BitLocker during the initial imaging stage of a Windows deployment can lower the administrative overhead necessary for implementing MBAM in an organization.

segment.source: It also ensures that every computer that is deployed already has BitLocker running and is configured correctly.
segment.target: It also ensures that every computer that is deployed already has BitLocker running and is configured correctly.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The procedure in this topic describes modifying the Windows registry.
segment.target: The procedure in this topic describes modifying the Windows registry.

segment.source: Using Registry Editor incorrectly can cause serious problems that may require you to reinstall Windows.
segment.target: Using Registry Editor incorrectly can cause serious problems that may require you to reinstall Windows.

segment.source: Microsoft cannot guarantee that problems resulting from the incorrect use of Registry Editor can be solved.
segment.target: Microsoft cannot guarantee that problems resulting from the incorrect use of Registry Editor can be solved.

segment.source: Use Registry Editor at your own risk.
segment.target: Use Registry Editor at your own risk.

segment.source: To encrypt a computer as part of Windows deployment
segment.target: To encrypt a computer as part of Windows deployment

segment.source: If your organization is planning to use the Trusted Platform Module (TPM) protector or the TPM + PIN protector options in BitLocker, you must activate the TPM chip before the initial deployment of MBAM.
segment.target: If your organization is planning to use the Trusted Platform Module (TPM) protector or the TPM + PIN protector options in BitLocker, you must activate the TPM chip before the initial deployment of MBAM.

segment.source: When you activate the TPM chip, you avoid a reboot later in the process, and you ensure that the TPM chips are correctly configured according to the requirements of your organization.
segment.target: When you activate the TPM chip, you avoid a reboot later in the process, and you ensure that the TPM chips are correctly configured according to the requirements of your organization.

segment.source: You must activate the TPM chip manually in the BIOS of the computer.
segment.target: You must activate the TPM chip manually in the BIOS of the computer.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Some vendors provide tools to turn on and activate the TPM chip in the BIOS from within the operating system.
segment.target: Some vendors provide tools to turn on and activate the TPM chip in the BIOS from within the operating system.

segment.source: Refer to the manufacturer documentation for more details about how to configure the TPM chip.
segment.target: Refer to the manufacturer documentation for more details about how to configure the TPM chip.

segment.source: Install the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring client agent.
segment.target: Install the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring client agent.

segment.source: Join the computer to a domain (recommended).
segment.target: Join the computer to a domain (recommended).

segment.source: If the computer is not joined to the domain, the recovery password is not stored in the MBAM Key Recovery service.
segment.target: If the computer is not joined to the domain, the recovery password is not stored in the MBAM Key Recovery service.

segment.source: By default, MBAM does not allow encryption to occur unless the recovery key can be stored.
segment.target: By default, MBAM does not allow encryption to occur unless the recovery key can be stored.

segment.source: If a computer starts in recovery mode before the recovery key is stored on the MBAM Server, the computer has to be reimaged.
segment.target: If a computer starts in recovery mode before the recovery key is stored on the MBAM Server, the computer has to be reimaged.

segment.source: No recovery method is available.
segment.target: No recovery method is available.

segment.source: Run the command prompt as an administrator, stop the MBAM service, and then set the service to manual or on demand, and then start by typing the following commands:
segment.target: Run the command prompt as an administrator, stop the MBAM service, and then set the service to manual or on demand, and then start by typing the following commands:

segment.source: net stop mbamagent
segment.target: net stop mbamagent

segment.source: sc config mbamagent start= demand
segment.target: sc config mbamagent start= demand

segment.source: Set the registry settings for the MBAM agent to ignore Group Policy and run the TPM for operating system only encryption by running Regedit, and then importing the registry key template from C:Program FilesMicrosoftMDOP MBAMMBAMDeploymentKeyTemplate.reg.
segment.target: Set the registry settings for the MBAM agent to ignore Group Policy and run the TPM for operating system only encryption by running Regedit, and then importing the registry key template from C:Program FilesMicrosoftMDOP MBAMMBAMDeploymentKeyTemplate.reg.

segment.source: In regedit, go to HKLMSOFTWAREMicrosoftMBAM, and configure the settings that are listed in the following table.
segment.target: In regedit, go to HKLMSOFTWAREMicrosoftMBAM, and configure the settings that are listed in the following table.

segment.source: Registry entry
segment.target: Registry entry

segment.source: Configuration settings
segment.target: Configuration settings

segment.source: DeploymentTime
segment.target: DeploymentTime

segment.source: 0 = OFF
segment.target: 0 = OFF

segment.source: 1 = Use deployment time policy settings (default)
segment.target: 1 = Use deployment time policy settings (default)

segment.source: UseKeyRecoveryService
segment.target: UseKeyRecoveryService

segment.source: 0 = Do not use key escrow ( the next two registry entries are not required in this case)
segment.target: 0 = Do not use key escrow ( the next two registry entries are not required in this case)

segment.source: 1 = Use key escrow in Key Recovery system (default)
segment.target: 1 = Use key escrow in Key Recovery system (default)

segment.source: Recommended: The computer must be able to communicate with the Key Recovery service.
segment.target: Recommended: The computer must be able to communicate with the Key Recovery service.

segment.source: Verify that the computer can communicate with the service before you proceed.
segment.target: Verify that the computer can communicate with the service before you proceed.

segment.target: KeyRecoveryOptions

segment.source: 0 = Uploads Recovery Key Only
segment.target: 0 = Uploads Recovery Key Only

segment.source: 1 = Uploads Recovery Key and Key Recovery Package (default)
segment.target: 1 = Uploads Recovery Key and Key Recovery Package (default)

segment.source: KeyRecoveryServiceEndPoint
segment.target: KeyRecoveryServiceEndPoint

segment.source: Set this value to the URL for the Key Recovery web server, for example, http://computer name/MBAMRecoveryAndHardwareService/CoreService.svc.
segment.target: Set this value to the URL for the Key Recovery web server, for example, http://computer name/MBAMRecoveryAndHardwareService/CoreService.svc.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: MBAM policy or registry values can be set here to override previously set values.
segment.target: MBAM policy or registry values can be set here to override previously set values.

segment.source: The MBAM agent restarts the system during MBAM client deployment.
segment.target: The MBAM agent restarts the system during MBAM client deployment.

segment.source: When you are ready for this reboot, run the following command at a command prompt as an administrator:
segment.target: When you are ready for this reboot, run the following command at a command prompt as an administrator:

segment.source: net start mbamagent
segment.target: net start mbamagent

segment.source: When the computers restarts, and the BIOS prompts you to accept a TPM change, accept the change.
segment.target: When the computers restarts, and the BIOS prompts you to accept a TPM change, accept the change.

segment.source: During the Windows client operating system imaging process, when you are ready to start encryption, restart the MBAM agent service, and set start to automatic by running a command prompt as an administrator and typing the following commands:
segment.target: During the Windows client operating system imaging process, when you are ready to start encryption, restart the MBAM agent service, and set start to automatic by running a command prompt as an administrator and typing the following commands:

segment.source: sc config mbamagent start= auto
segment.target: sc config mbamagent start= auto

segment.source: net start mbamagent
segment.target: net start mbamagent

segment.source: Remove the bypass registry values by running Regedit and going to the HKLMSOFTWAREMicrosoft registry entry.
segment.target: Remove the bypass registry values by running Regedit and going to the HKLMSOFTWAREMicrosoft registry entry.

segment.source: To delete the MBAM node, right-click the node and click Delete.
segment.target: To delete the MBAM node, right-click the node and click Delete.
